name: Have a Safe Ride: Timed Edition Available Thru December 31st
description:
Limited Edition: Available for Purchase thru December 2013

"Have a Safe Ride" encourages condom use when engaging in sexual activity.  Created to help support SMART+ efforts, a New York City non-profit organization that helps provide women of color and youth that are living with HIV/AIDS with the skills and education they need to  to continue to lie strong, healthy lives. 

Options:
$30.00 
12 x 12 inches 
Giclee Print on High Quality Artist Paper 

$85.00
15 x 15 inches
Stretched Canvas Print

$130.00
19 x 19 inches 
Framed Print 

A series of work will be created for the organization thru the month of December to help drive awareness and educate more of our youth and adults on the prevention of HIV and AIDS. 
---------------------------------------------------------- 
Our prints are 100% manufactured and printed in the USA. We use American made paper and print this design locally. This process allows us to support US businesses, keep the cost low so that it is affordable for all people, and still make an impact.

name: The Lost Childhoods: Limited Edition SOLD OUT
description:
12 x 12 inches 
Giclee Print on High Quality Artist Paper 
Limited Edition: Available for Purchase thru November 2013

"The Lost Childhoods" discusses the present state of Chicago from the eyes of our youth. While out at play they are aware of the number of friends they have lost to unnecessary crime acts in Chicago. Part of the lost treasures they find are the bullet shells that have taken their friends lives. 

This piece will help to benefit organization The Lost Childhoods of Chiraq, which is working to develop programs to help deter this violence. 
---------------------------------------------------------- 
Our prints are 100% manufactured and printed in the USA. We use American made paper and print this design locally. This process allows us to support US businesses, keep the cost low so that it is affordable for all people, and still make an impact.

name: The Waiting Game: Limited Edition SOLD OUT
description:
12 x 12 inches 
Giclee Print on High Quality Artist Paper 
Limited Edition: Available for Purchase thru October 2013

This piece reflects reality of the youth that Project Fierce Chicago is trying to help. With thousands or homeless youth and not enough beds or shelters to sleep in, they often are left out in the cold.  

Project Fierce is on a mission to provide homes for homeless LGBT youth so that they can live a normal life and be themselves in a home and environment that provides them with the love, care and shelter one would expect to have from their family.
---------------------------------------------------------- 
Our prints are 100% manufactured and printed in the USA. We use American made paper and print this design locally. This process allows us to support US businesses, keep the cost low so that it is affordable for all people, and still make an impact.

name: Helping Hands: Limited Edition SOLD OUT
description:
12 x 12 inches 
Giclee Print on High Quality Artist Paper 
Limited Timed Edition: Available for Purchase thru October 2013

This piece reflects the support that Project Fierce Chicago provides for homeless LGBT youth to help them receive the love, structure, and guidance they need to live a normal life.
---------------------------------------------------------- 
Our prints are 100% manufactured and printed in the USA. We use American made paper and print this design locally. This process allows us to support US businesses, keep the cost low so that it is affordable for all people, and still make an impact.

name: Be Who You Are: Limited Edition SOLD OUT
description:
12 x 12 inches 
Giclee Print on High Quality Artist Paper 
Limited Edition: Available for Purchase thru October 2013

This piece reflects the goal of non-profit Organization, Project Fierce Chicago. They are on a mission to provide homes for homeless LGBT youth so that they can live a normal life and be themselves in a home and environment that provides them with the love, care and shelter one would expect to have from their family.  

Project Fierce provides a space for LGBT youth to be themselves comfortably while they face the challenge of being homeless and deal with other obstacles to get back on their feet. 
----------------------------------------------------------
Our prints are 100% manufactured and printed in the USA. We use American made paper and print this design locally. This process allows us to support US businesses, keep the cost low so that it is affordable for all people, and still make an impact.

name: A Safe Place to Call Home: Limited Edition SOLD OUT
description:
12 x 12 inches 
Giclee Print on High Quality Artist Paper 
Limited Edition: Available for Purchase thru October 2013

This piece reflects the goal of non-profit Organization, Project Fierce Chicago. They are on a mission to provide homes for homeless LGBT youth so that they can live in everyday neighbrhoods and come home to an environment that is similar to what they would have with their own families. 

Project Fierce provides a safe place for them to call home instead of them living among the chaos of the city in the streets or subways. 
----------------------------------------------------------
Our prints are 100% manufactured and printed in the USA. We use American made paper and print this design locally. This process allows us to support US businesses, keep the cost low so that it is affordable for all people, and still make an impact.

12 x 12 inches
Screen printed on 100# Grout Gray French Paper

Our prints are 100% manufactured and printed in the USA.  We use American made paper and print this design in-house.  This process allows us to support US businesses, keep the cost low so that it is affordable for all people, and still make an impact.

name: Curlers & Cigarette's: Smooth
description:
Oil on Canvas, 24 x 36 

Women have the ability to create energy, make a statement and change someone's mind by the way they move or through a simple gesture. I wanted to explore the variety of personality and attitude that can come through when different women take on the same action. Curlers and Cigarettes are the two devices I use in to travel through different decades and cultures revealing the appeal and the charisma that only women can wield.

name: Curlers & Cigarettes: Marvel Model
description:
Oil on wood
29.5 x 41

name: Curlers & Cigarettes: Some Fade Away
description:
Oil on Recycled Canvas (Framed)
27.5 x 39.5

name: Curlers & Cigarettes: I used to love her
description:
Oil on Recycled Wood Board, Framed 
32.5 x 39.5

name: Do You See Me?
description:
Acrylic on Canvas, 25x38

On a daily basis I encounter people suffering from homelessness, and my curiosity wonders how many of them we actually see as humans. Do we see the debris and clutter that they often carry with them, or do we see the person for who they are? Some of the best conversations I’ve had are with people of a lesser economic status. The stories they have to share will blow your mind.

name: Revamping the Ickes: SOLD
description:
Acrylic on Canvas, 24x26

A constant curiosity, this piece questions the psychological effects that occur in the children who experience the quick turnaround of gentrification and how that changes their growth and outlook on life.

name: Maxwell Street Chicken Man
description:
Acrylic on Canvas, 27x34

A regular street performer on Chicago’s original Maxwell Street, the Chicken Man trained chickens to dance to entertain visitors and locals. You could often find him riding public transit with a chicken 
sitting on his hat.

name: Ring Around the Rosies
description:
Oil on Canvas, 24x30

There is an unfortunate amount of youth killed in Chicago on a regular basis unnecessarily. This piece discusses the circles of roses we spread around the cities for the lives lost.

name: The 40% : SOLD
description:
Oil on Canvas, 24x36 -- SOLD

40% of homeless youth identify at LGBT. Of this 40%, 68% are homeless due to some form of family rejection. This piece is for those youth, in hopes they don’t let their colors that shine bright fade.

name: Over Under Through : SOLD
description:
Acrylic on Canvas, 29x57

This piece reflects on the artists experience growing up in and living in a big city. Sometimes it can weigh you down, other times it makes you feel like you’re on top of the world, but most often it shapes you and runs through you.
